Aggregate Dataset

Source: R/wid_aggregate.R
wid_aggregate.Rd

Create aggregates from the dataset.

Usage

wid_aggregate(data_dir, ..., levels = list(), cell_cutoff = 30,
  cores = parallel::detectCores() - 2)

Arguments

data_dir

Path to the dataset, to be opened by wid_open.

...

Arguments to pass to wid_subset.

levels

A list containing new or redefined summaries to include. The name of each entry determines the variable value, with named vectors defining each level (e.g., list(age = c(`Under 20` = "age < 20", `Over 60` = "age > 60"))).

cell_cutoff

Minimal cell size to retain; cells with count < cell_cutoff will be removed.

cores

Number of CPU cores to use.

Value

An aggregated version of db.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{

# aggregate a subset of the full dataset
data <- wid_open() |> dplyr::filter(country == "AGO")
aggregated_ago <- wid_aggregate(data)
} # }
